items.title: US discussing possible military options in pursuit of acquiring Greenland
items.description: The US president and his officials are continuing to push for an American takeover of the Danish territory in the wake of their successful Venezuela operation, saying the island is needed for national security.

items.title: Live: Trump's Greenland threats a negotiating tactic, Rubio says
items.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has reportedly told Trump administration officials at a closed briefing that Donald Trump's open threats to take over Greenland are a negotiating tactic to pressure Denmark into doing a deal. Follow live.

items.title: The world order we know is being turned upside down
items.description: The global shock caused by the Trump administration's interventions in Venezuela sent analysts scurrying for historic comparisons, but nothing really compares to what happened at the weekend.

items.title: Breaking: Inflation cools in November but still above the RBA's target
items.description: Inflation cooled in November, with the consumer price index rising 3.4 per cent over the year, down from 3.8 per cent a month earlier.

items.title: Live: ASX adds to gains as inflation slows more than expected
items.description: The CPI rose 3.4 per cent in the 12 months to November 2025, according to the latest ABS data — down from 3.8 per cent in October and below economists' expectations. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Live: Australia all out with a 183-run lead as injury worsens England's nightmare
items.description: Steve Smith falls for 138 and Australia is all out for 567 after England captain Ben Stokes limps off mid-over with a groin injury early on day four of the SCG Test. Follow live.

items.title: Bayer's Monsanto sues COVID vaccine makers for alleged mRNA infringement
items.description: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna, for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

items.title: How an encounter with an AI hallucination raised an ethical dilemma
items.description: When a journalist emails a company with questions looking for answers, the least they expect is a real person to feed them the spin, half-truths or outright lies. Not a machine.

items.title: The bizarre tale of Angie Fuller's disappearance still baffles police three years on
items.description: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

items.title: Men charged over alleged international car theft syndicate targeting Toyota 4WDs
items.description: Queensland Police say 60 Toyota LandCruisers and Prados were stolen across Brisbane between October 20 and December 1.

items.title: Kidman and Urban divorce after two decades as red carpet power couple
items.description: After 19 years as one of the entertainment world's most recognisable couples, actor Nicole Kidman and musician Keith Urban are officially divorced.

items.title: Calls for a royal commission into Bondi an untenable political distraction
items.description: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

items.title: Europe, US and NATO leaders agree to provide security guarantees to Ukraine
items.description: At a key meeting in Paris, officials from Europe, Canada, the US and NATO said they would provide Kyiv's frontline forces with equipment and training, and back them up with air, land and sea support to deter any future Russian attack.

items.title: Live: Heatwave warnings for large parts of Australia as bushfire risk soars
items.description: Large areas of Australia, from Western Australia's north-west to Tasmania's north-east, have been issued with severe to extreme heatwave warnings from Wednesday to Saturday. Follow our live blog.

items.title: Machete ambush after teenagers lured to park in Melbourne's west
items.description: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

items.title: 'High volume' response after application for QVB windows to be made clear
items.description: Dozens of people express opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

items.title: Surprise proposal at school leaves WA teacher in shock
items.description: Students at one of Western Australia's most remote schools help play a part in a special proposal for two of their teachers.

items.title: Missing toddler found dead in Bundaberg
items.description: The three-year-old's death is not being treated as suspicious and a report will be prepared for the coroner.

items.title: Remote pub at centre of Peter Falconio mystery has liquor licence suspended
items.description: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

items.title: Videos made by SA librarians attract likes from Ariana Grande
items.description: The team at Adelaide's City of Marion Libraries grows a legion of fans on social media and sees their videos go viral, clocking up millions of views.

items.title: De Minaur reveals reason for making 'brutal' Davis Cup call
items.description: For the first time since making his debut in 2018, Alex de Minaur decides to sit out an Australian Davis Cup tie.

items.title: Tomljanović departs Brisbane International as Hijikata advances
items.description: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović loses a tense three-set match to world number 20 Karolína Muchová, while Rinky Hijikata is the last remaining local hope in the men's draw.

items.title: Perth Bears add experience to their roster by signing Bulldogs forward
items.description: The Perth Bears land their most experienced NRL player so far in their recruitment drive, signing Canterbury's Josh Curran on a three-year deal.

items.title: Care workers say they are powerless to stop children using ice
items.description: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

items.title: 'It wasn't your fault': Ben Austin's parents offer support for other boy involved in cricket tragedy
items.description: Ben Austin died after a cricket ball struck him in late October. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no one is to blame for the tragic accident.
